job_title: Hospice Team Coordinator in Kansas City, MO
pros: This company truly cares about it's employees. Having been in the workforce for decades, this is the most compassionate group of people, from the field staff to the office staff and especially the leadership.
cons: The only cons are industry norms for healthcare.

job_title: Manager of Quality in Kansas City, MO
pros: Everything that was shared to me in my interview was true. The administration is involved with their staff and there is an open door policy. Improvements in processes are always being made. Nothing is static and that makes the work interesting. VNA has a long history in the community, which is a really cool thing.
cons: It's a little hard to get to know people at first because everyone is busy, but the culture is good. Coworkers and management are supportive!

review_title: Great place to work & internally expand your career opportunities
job_title: Clinical Manager in Kansas City, MO
pros: Excellent clinicians and office personnel who care about our patients and work together to strive to help our patients.
cons: Challenges in home health in general with Medicare cuts and funding.

pros: This is the most supportive, flexible home health company I’ve ever seen. The staff takes care of each other well, no matter which team.
cons: Can have occasional long drives, but listening to music, podcast or audio book takes care of that.

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Kansas City, MO
pros: Love the personal feel of providing in home care to our clients. Supportive and nice management. I love working here!!
cons: I have not experienced any yet.

job_title: Human Resources & Payroll Specialist in Kansas City, MO
pros: PROS - VNA employees some of the best people I've ever worked with. Very hard-working and dedicated. VNA has GREAT benefits and really cares about staff.
cons: CONS - With the healthcare worker shortage, staff have been very busy, but that seems to be getting better in the last few months.

cons:

Rude, unprofessional , administrative team who only care about themselves and not the company as a whole.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Kansas City, MO
pros: Pay is decent, benefits are great
cons: Lack of communication is an issue. Punitive steps up to termination if you miss work, even with a valid/documented reason.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Kansas City, MO
pros: Time spent actually working with patients.
cons: My experience: I was hired with an agreed upon coverage area, which factored heavily in my decision to accept the position offered. Within months this territory was expanded over 30 miles north. Now, a year later, it is being expanded an additional 55 miles east! Just know that if you're unable to see the minimum number of patient expected each day due to longer drive times, they won't hesitate to take away your PTO to compensate the company for it. They are totally non-receptive to my concerns when voiced and tell me that's the nature of the business and I'm lucky for the opportunity. Just know that you can expect them to sit there smiling making offers they have no intention of keeping.

review_title: Too bad management is not supportive.
job_title: Registered Nurse in Kansas City, MO
pros: Patients are grateful, and make you feel good about doing your job.
cons: Work load is unreasonable, too much expected. Managers give conflicting information and possibly set employees up for failure.
Sometimes the days are a little long, but we are there to take care of the patients -- that is our goal.
